items.title: Man United ask Fletcher to coach FA Cup Sunday
items.summary: Darren Fletcher said he will be on the touchline for Manchester United's FA Cup tie against Brighton on Sunday.

items.title: Rosenior unready to coach Chelsea loss at Fulham
items.summary: Liam Rosenior chose not to take charge of Chelsea for the first time in Wednesday's Premier League clash against Fulham because of the "difficult time-frame" between his appointment on Tuesday and the game at Craven Cottage.

items.title: Mourinho on shock loss: I hope players don't sleep
items.summary: An angry Benfica coach Jose Mourinho hopes his players had a sleepless night after their shock defeat to Braga in the Portuguese Allianz Cup semifinal on Wednesday.

items.title: Semenyo gets 'fairytale ending' before City move
items.summary: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola all but confirmed Antoine Semenyo's impending transfer to Manchester City as he hailed the winger's "fairytale ending" in scoring a late winner against Tottenham Hotspur on Wednesday.

items.title: Moyes woedend over rood wegens harentrekken: 'Belachelijke beslissing'
items.summary: Everton-verdediger Michael Keane kreeg woensdagavond een rode kaart wegens het aan de haren trekken van Wolverhampton Wanderers-spits Tolu Arokodare. Manager David Moyes hekelde die beslissing na afloop.

items.title: Vriends verlengt Australisch avontuur en tekent bij in Adelaide
items.summary: Bart Vriends heeft zijn contract bij Adelaide United verlengd tot medio 2027 met een optie voor nog een jaar. De 34-jarige Nederlander maakte in de zomer van 2024 transfervrij de overstap van Sparta Rotterdam.

items.title: â€˜The club is in a messâ€™: Manchester United fans voice feelings before the next interim twist
items.summary: Supporters serenaded SolskjÃ¦r, Carrick and Fletcher among others at Burnley and staged a brief anti-Ratcliffe protest â€œJim canâ€™t fix it,â€ the sign said. A dozen red letters nestled on a white background, a stark contrast in an away end at Burnley full of dark-coated figures in front of which they were held aloft. It was small, a couple of square metres of material, maybe. But the message to Sir Jim Ratcliffe was powerful. Remember your lane, Jim? Yeah, stick in it, pal. As Darren Fletcher, in Manchester United blazer and red tie, strolled along the touchline, flanked by tracksuited his former teammate and friend Jonny Evans, the flag flew. And then it was gone. The protest was done. Continue reading...

items.title: Can Coventry recover from recent blip to maintain promotion charge?
items.summary: Six points clear at the top of the Championship as we swing into January was more than any Coventry City fan would have expected when the seaason started back in August.

items.title: De Excelsior-aanvoerder die droomt van de Premier League en het WK
items.summary: Casper Widell (22) is bezig aan zijn derde seizoen bij Excelsior. Hij is met zijn onverzettelijkheid een vaste waarde centraal achterin en weet dat een jonge speler na drie jaar Excelsior een stap moet maken. â€˜Maar eerst Excelsior goed achterlaten.â€™

items.title: Fresh start or back to square one? Either way, Man United are never dull
items.summary: After the tumult of Ruben Amorim's dismissal on Monday, Darren Fletcher and Manchester United's 2-2 draw vs. Burnley was fittingly dramatic.

items.title: Heracles huurt AZ-spits Zeefuik met optie tot koop
items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Sarri uit frustratie over transferbeleid Lazio en kent nieuwe spits niet
items.summary: Maurizio Sarri is niet blij met de verkoop van MattÃ©o Guendouzi aan FenerbahÃ§e. De trainer van Lazio uitte na het gelijkspel tegen Fiorentina niet voor het eerst zijn frustatie over het transferbeleid van de Italiaanse club, die ook een spits heeft aangetrokken die Sarri totaal niet kent.

items.title: Terry Yorath, former Wales and Leeds midfielder, dies aged 75
items.summary: A league champion with Leeds, midfielder won 59 caps As Wales manager just missed out on 1994 World Cup The former Leeds and Wales midfielder Terry Yorath has died at the age of 75 after a short illness, his family have said in a statement. Born in Cardiff, Yorath played a big part in the Leeds team under Don Revie, winning the First Division title in 1974, before spells with Coventry, Tottenham and Bradford. He also won 59 caps for Wales. Continue reading...

items.title: Football transfer rumours: Ethan Nwaneri to replace Semenyo at Bournemouth?
items.summary: Todayâ€™s rumours are riding the District line Antoine Semenyoâ€™s farewell goal for Bournemouth, before his move to Manchester City, sets off a chain reaction over who succeeds him. Ethan Nwaneri, who has struggled for game time at Arsenal, is wanted by a few suitors. Bournemouth are very interested in a loan move for someone who was the next big thing not too long ago. And still can be, though the word is he still wishes to stay a Gunner and play his part in a title-winning team. Continue reading...

items.title: England player ratings after another away Ashes series goes horribly wrong
items.summary: Here is how we rated England's players out of 10 after the 4-1 Ashes series defeat in Australia...

items.title: Cristian Romero takes apparent swipe at Spurs board for staying silent as team struggle
items.summary: Reference to â€˜liesâ€™ deleted from his social media post â€˜It should be other people coming out to speak,â€™ he writes Cristian Romero has taken an apparent swipe at Tottenhamâ€™s board for staying silent amid the teamâ€™s struggles. The captain posted a strongly worded message after Wednesdayâ€™s 3-2 defeat at Bournemouth that initially appeared to accuse the hierarchy of telling â€œliesâ€ before being edited to remove that incendiary reference. What remained on Romeroâ€™s Instagram post, though, was what an apparent call for the Spurs directors to speak up. The players were again subjected to abuse by some of their fans after a latest loss that leaves Tottenham with five points from their past six matches, three of which have ended in defeat. Continue reading...

items.title: A warrior touched by tragedy - Terry Yorath obituary
items.summary: Former Wales captain and manager Terry Yorath, who has died aged 75, had a glittering career, but his life was deeply affected by two tragedies.

items.title: Leeds and Wales legend Yorath dies aged 75
items.summary: Terry Yorath, who won the league title with Leeds in 1974 and came close to guiding Wales to the 1994 World Cup finals, dies at the age of 75.

items.title: Brook apologises for 'embarrassing' clash with bouncer in New Zealand
items.summary: England's Harry Brook has apologised for "embarrassing myself and the team" after an altercation with a nightclub bouncer in New Zealand last autumn.

items.title: Sabalenka to skip events in 'insane' 2026 despite likely WTA sanctions
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka expects to skip events again this year rather than put her health at risk â€Œover the course of an "insane" season, even though she knows she is likely to be sanctioned by the WTA â€‹Tour for doing so, the world No 1 said.
